replies.msg:
無懼打手，大家可以繼續交作文，我會繼續改！

解文片段在這裡： 
https://www.facebook.com/HayGorEnglish/ 

簡介： 
前補習天王軍師，知道咩技巧先係有用，咩係呃細路。 
今年收左幾個retakers 好向左走向右走火滾發覺出面啲補習天王唔知教緊乜 
作文就教好多深句式 但唔識教你點諗point你識得寫咩高頻句構有乜用 
幫左好多Retaker 巴打一齊開study group 個個都話一打開卷就知俾人呃左成年 


大家有咩問題關於DSE英文隨便發問，收集左啲同類問題我會一次過拍片教或者加少少野俾你地讀， 
問完俾少少時間我準備。 
大家可以係度分享下有用資訊，互相交流同幫助下。 

你有無補開習都無所謂，我答你嘅野一定有用過宜家補習天王教你嘅野。

Frequently-Asked-Questions: 

Q1：Grammar底差做Grammar in use有無用？ 
答：做完你只識改，唔識造句，等於完全無用。￼ 

Q2：補習老師話唔寫靚句構一定無5**，是否屬實？ 
答：HKEAA評分框架並沒有呢一項，背百搭句式可取5**只係呃細路技倆。￼ （已拍片解釋） 

Q3：點樣可以諗啲靚point令我篇議論文高分啲？ 
答：第一，HKEAA評分框架並沒有指出要論點特別先高分。第二，宜家考嘅已經唔係議論文，補習天王抄襲舊有筆記無新野教所以只可教舊Skills，新內容只有一堆真跡，但唔會教到你有好英文。 （已拍片解釋） 

Q4：你話補習天王教百搭argument 無用，點解你唔試下拍片逐條試下有無用？ 
答：都話無用點解逐條試？本身如果叫做百搭，有一年用唔到已經應該要拉去打靶。打手不如你拍片用俾我地睇下點樣用到呀？

Q5：學校話我得Level 3，但我覺得自己英文唔差，可以點做？ 
答：交文黎睇下就知咩事。

Q6：覺得自己英文最少有5，但點先上到5**？
答：唔好咁多廢話，一係交作文，一係等攞4。

Q7：有無話要寫幾多字先有5**？ 
答：Part A 約400字（但千萬不要加紙），Part B 約700字。不夠字數論證無可能合理，所以唔好再問有你可能300字有5**。300字你做齊個task每段都係得60-70字，你話有無可能5**。

Q8：Listening 同reading好差，有咩辦法？ 
答：每日閱讀BBC兩小時，唔識嘅字抄低晒佢然後查Google，每日訓前用15分鐘溫一次先訓。聽英文歌之餘每日煲一集美劇，可從以下選擇： 
1) Criminal Minds; 
2) NCIS; 
3) Game of Thrones。 
最底線都要睇雙語字幕，唔好睇純中文。方法俾左你，唔好靜係問問問，跟住做，如果你半年無進步先再問點算好。跟足我方法去做無人失敗過。

Q9：中六先浸英文會否太遲？唔夠時間一日掂兩個鐘英文。 
答：你寧願浪費時間問遲唔遲，都唔開始去做，你應該都無得救。 
（1日睇兩小時，放學唔夠時間係學校早讀課睇，有心做就永遠唔會有藉口。 或者上少陣高登都已經多半個鐘溫。 ） 

Q10：駁論是否一定要寫先有Level 5+？ 
答：否。題目無要求就無需要。 

Q11：練accent 方面，你覺得學British accent /American accent 較好？ 
答：Accent唔重要係因為每個地方嘅人都有自己accent，你模彷極都唔會100%地道。（大學有興趣了解可修讀linguistic courses）英國唔同地區都有唔同accent。我相信你所講嘅都只係"RP"，想學果種可以睇多啲BBC跟住黎練。以前大學上堂我都會特登用RP accent懶posh咁 ，但我唔打算拍片教，因為大部份人只會邯鄲學步，最後連基本英文都講唔反。小心。 

Q12：有d one coin has two sides 個d idioms/cliches 係唔係唔應該用？how about quotes? 係唔係只要適合就ok? 
答：係唔應該用，因為本身無論證意思，講完等於無講，廢話考官最憎。而現時DSE題目都無咩所謂嘅quotes係適用又唔奇怪。 

Q13：如果Listening Part B 成日都唔高分，做咩練習有用？UE Section E? 
答：一定唔係做section E。係因為你掛住抄data file，以為抄晒就拎爆分。 


Exam skills我唔想俾人抄晒，因為一教就識。會盡量諗辦法逐啲滲俾你地，你地Mark實個Channel，去到考試前應該會知道HKEAA真正想考你啲咩。 

其實考試制度一路都好有用，只係無人識教你所以搞到大家都覺得考埋啲野無鬼用，讀啲野又用唔到。其實只係一路都用錯方法。

篇長文未作完

Your school is holding a walkathon to raise money for charity.


Help to raise money to build schools in china.


Why take part?
This is a rare event where you can do exercise while raising money for the needy.
Many of the children living in rural and mountainous areas of China are still suffering from long commute to schools. Some of the poor children walk on treacherous terrains for hours just to get to school. The fund raised in this event will be fully donated to charity to help these poor children.


The route of the walk.
The walk starts from our school here in Kwun Tong. To get some feelings of how these poor children feel when they get to school, you will then need to do some trekking over the Lion Rock. After that , you will arrive at Tai Wai where will be your destination.


The Work of Walk to build.
Walk to build is a charitable organisation aiming build schools in mainland China. They were founded in 1990 when China saw an unprecedented economic growth but hundreds of millions of citizens were still illiterates.
Walk to build contributed to school building in three ways.


First, they recruit engineers and architect from all over the world to help decide energy efficient schools which can also resist earthquakes which are not uncommon in areas like Sichuan and northern China.


Second, money raised has been spent on building materials such as concrete, bricks and steel. These materials are absolutely indispensable for school building.


Third, they recruit and train teachers for schools in remote areas. Schools in remote areas are far from urban settings and many of the well-educated teachers are reluctant to travel long distance just to get to work. Walk to Build recruit teachers in their own communities and provide regular and high quality training for teachers. This programme has triumphed over the years. We have seen a significant increase in university admission rates of these village boys and girls.

其實我就咁Post文喺度方唔方便你 ？
我又作咗篇文，Practice Paper Part B Q5
Btw,其實今次作我第一次作DSE文，睇返PP見到全部都係Learning Through XXXXX ，唔知咁作啱唔啱，佢係想我用Debate Speech咁嘅形式交文？

5. Learning English through Debating
You are a member of the school debating club. Your club is entering a debating contest and the motion is Nuclear power is the best source of energy for the future. Decide whether you are for or against the motion and write your debate speech. The members with the best speeches will be chosen to represent the school at the competition.


Today, we are glad to be invited to attend a debate on the motion of ‘’Nuclear Power is the Best Source of Energy’’. We are against this motion. In the following section, we will look into some characteristics of nuclear energy and explain why it is not the best source of energy.


First of all and most importantly, nuclear energy is dangerous and toxic. The nuclear event that took place in Fukushima a few years ago teaches that nuclear energy could run out of control. In the Fukushima Power Plant disaster, the cores a reaction tower was molten and exposed, resulting in tremendous amount of radioactive active materials leaking into the ocean. The effects of the leak are hard to estimate but must be devastating to both the ecosystem and people living in the vicinity. Hundreds of thousands of residents were promptly evacuated.Despite this, some may argue that with the advance of technology, we could engineer the designs of the power plant to make it safer. However, natural disasters are natural disasters. Before the tsunami stroke, no one would imagine such a state-of-the-art nuclear power plant would turn into a beast.


What should never be overlooked is that nuclear wastes are carcinogenic and the effect is long lasting. The nuclear wastes as a result of power generation take many years to decay and they remained radioactive after use. These radioactive wastes must be kept in thick lead container and the surrounding areas must not be used for human activities. In populous places like Hong Kong where property prices are rocket high, sparing a large space to store such wastes is simply impractical. We must also remember that these radioactive wastes are no less dangerous than an active nuclear power plant, whenever there is an incident, the result must be cataclysmic.


Another issue with nuclear energy is the cost and accessibility. Such scarce metals as Uranium have to be extracted to act as a nucleus for nuclear fission in the energy-generating process. Understandably, these rare metals are very expensive and hard to access. Developing countries with less advanced technology simply could not make use of nuclear energy. To be the best energy, it has to be widely accessible and comes in low costs. Solar energy is an exemplary candidate when it comes to accessibility. It is readily accessible - whenever there is sunlight and a solar board, solar energy can be extracted.


Given the limitations and potential hazards of nuclear energy, in no way could it be the best energy. In recent years, many new forms of sustainable energy source emerged. There is no denying that no single energy could cater for all places in the world, but if it is to choose the best energy, the best bet is on solar energy. It is readily accessible, completely free and clean, easy to be extracted and stable at least for the coming billion of years.


After taken into considerations all these drawbacks of nuclear energy and the fact that better alternatives do exist, we have come to an unanimous agreement that nuclear could not be the best source of energy.

Btw,其實今次作我第一次作DSE文，睇返PP見到全部都係Learning Through XXXXX ，唔知咁作啱唔啱，佢係想我用Debate Speech咁嘅形式交文？

5. Learning English through Debating
You are a member of the school debating club. Your club is entering a debating contest and the motion is Nuclear power is the best source of energy for the future. Decide whether you are for or against the motion and write your debate speech. The members with the best speeches will be chosen to represent the school at the competition.


Today, we are glad to be invited to attend a debate on the motion of ‘’Nuclear Power is the Best Source of Energy’’. We are against this motion. In the following section, we will look into some characteristics of nuclear energy and explain why it is not the best source of energy.


First of all and most importantly, nuclear energy is dangerous and toxic. The nuclear event that took place in Fukushima a few years ago teaches that nuclear energy could run out of control. In the Fukushima Power Plant disaster, the cores a reaction tower was molten and exposed, resulting in tremendous amount of radioactive active materials leaking into the ocean. The effects of the leak are hard to estimate but must be devastating to both the ecosystem and people living in the vicinity. Hundreds of thousands of residents were promptly evacuated.Despite this, some may argue that with the advance of technology, we could engineer the designs of the power plant to make it safer. However, natural disasters are natural disasters. Before the tsunami stroke, no one would imagine such a state-of-the-art nuclear power plant would turn into a beast.


What should never be overlooked is that nuclear wastes are carcinogenic and the effect is long lasting. The nuclear wastes as a result of power generation take many years to decay and they remained radioactive after use. These radioactive wastes must be kept in thick lead container and the surrounding areas must not be used for human activities. In populous places like Hong Kong where property prices are rocket high, sparing a large space to store such wastes is simply impractical. We must also remember that these radioactive wastes are no less dangerous than an active nuclear power plant, whenever there is an incident, the result must be cataclysmic.


Another issue with nuclear energy is the cost and accessibility. Such scarce metals as Uranium have to be extracted to act as a nucleus for nuclear fission in the energy-generating process. Understandably, these rare metals are very expensive and hard to access. Developing countries with less advanced technology simply could not make use of nuclear energy. To be the best energy, it has to be widely accessible and comes in low costs. Solar energy is an exemplary candidate when it comes to accessibility. It is readily accessible - whenever there is sunlight and a solar board, solar energy can be extracted.


Given the limitations and potential hazards of nuclear energy, in no way could it be the best energy. In recent years, many new forms of sustainable energy source emerged. There is no denying that no single energy could cater for all places in the world, but if it is to choose the best energy, the best bet is on solar energy. It is readily accessible, completely free and clean, easy to be extracted and stable at least for the coming billion of years.


After taking into considerations all these drawbacks of nuclear energy and the fact that better alternatives do exist, we have come to an unanimous agreement that nuclear could not be the best source of energy.
